class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function.     <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;

        }

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

          }

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Chrome version: 101.0.4951<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 101.0.4951<!----></span><br><br>[0] The `browser_context_` is posted to a separate sequence in function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback`<span class="line"><!---->[0] The `browser_context_` is posted to a separate sequence in function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback`<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144<!----></a><br>```<span public_key,<!----></span><br>    const base::FilePath& unpacked_dir,<span class="line"><!---->    const base::FilePath&amp; unpacked_dir,<!----></span><br>    bool install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->    bool install_immediately,<!----></span><br>    UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<span class="line"><!---->    UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<!----></span><br>  VLOG(3) << "UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback " << extension_id << " "<span class="line"><!---->  VLOG(3) &lt;&lt; "UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback " &lt;&lt; extension_id &lt;&lt; " "<!----></span><br>          << public_key;<span class="line"><!---->          &lt;&lt; public_key;<!----></span><br><br>  if (!browser_context_) {<span class="line"><!----> base::MayBlock()},<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::BEST_EFFORT, base::MayBlock()},<!----></span><br>        base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir));<span class="line"><!---->        base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir));<!----></span><br>    content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTask(<span class="line"><!----> base::BindOnce(std::move(update_client_callback),<span class="line"><!---->        base::BindOnce(std::move(update_client_callback),<!----></span><br>                       update_client::CrxInstaller::Result(<span class="line"><!---->                       update_client::CrxInstaller::Result(<!----></span><br>                           update_client::InstallError::GENERIC_ERROR)));<span class="line"><!---->                           update_client::InstallError::GENERIC_ERROR)));<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->  content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(InstallUpdateCallback, browser_context_, extension_id,		// `browser_context_` can be freed before task is runned<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(InstallUpdateCallback, browser_context_, extension_id,		// `browser_context_` can be freed before task is runned<!----></span><br>                     public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->                     public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>                     std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] `browser_context_` may be destroyed in UI by the time the it runs, causing a UAF in InstallUpdateCallback callback.<span class="line"><!---->[1] `browser_context_` may be destroyed in UI by the time the it runs, causing a UAF in InstallUpdateCallback callback.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<span class="line"><!---->void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<!----></span><br>                           const std::string& extension_id,<span class="line"><!---->                           const std::string&amp; extension_id,<!----></span><br>                           const std::string& public_key,<span class="line"><!---->                           const std::string&amp; public_key,<!----></span><br>                           const base::FilePath& unpacked_dir,<span class="line"><!---->                           const base::FilePath&amp; unpacked_dir,<!----></span><br>                           bool install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->                           bool install_immediately,<!----></span><br>                           UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<span class="line"><!---->                           UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<!----></span><br>  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<span class="line"><!---->  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<!----></span><br>  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<span class="line"><!---->  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<!----></span><br>  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<span class="line"><!---->  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<!----></span><br>  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<span class="line"><!---->  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<!----></span><br>  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)->InstallUpdate(<span class="line"><!---->  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)-&gt;InstallUpdate(<!----></span><br>      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<span class="line"><!---->          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<!----></span><br>             const absl::optional<CrxInstallError>& error) {<span class="line"><!---->             const absl::optional&lt;CrxInstallError&gt;&amp; error) {<!----></span><br>            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<span class="line"><!---->            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<!----></span><br>            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<span class="line"><!---->            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<!----></span><br>            if (error.has_value()) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (error.has_value()) {<!----></span><br>              int detail =<span class="line"><!---->              int detail =<!----></span><br>                  error->type() ==<span class="line"><!---->                  error-&gt;type() ==<!----></span><br>                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<span class="line"><!---->                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<!----></span><br>                      ? static_cast<int>(error->sandbox_failure_detail())<span class="line"><!---->                      ? static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;sandbox_failure_detail())<!----></span><br>                      : static_cast<int>(error->detail());<span class="line"><!---->                      : static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;detail());<!----></span><br>              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error->type(), detail);<span class="line"><!---->              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error-&gt;type(), detail);<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            std::move(callback).Run(result);<span class="line"><!---->            std::move(callback).Run(result);<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->          std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<span class="line"><!---->[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<!----></span><br> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<span class="line"><!----> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<!----></span><br>  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<span class="line"><!---->  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<!----></span><br>   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<span class="line"><!---->   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<!----></span><br>    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<span class="line"><!---->    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<!----></span><br><br><br>[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <span class="line"><!---->[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <!----></span><br><br>I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323449<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323449" title="Security: Use-after-Free in InstallUpdateCallback"><!---->Bug: 1323449<!----></a><br>Change-Id: If617676d2e0e6a31a7936d88c75dd221c69b1057<span <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin &lt;<!----></span>rdevlin.cronin@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/rdevlin.cronin@chromium.org"><!---->rdevlin.cronin@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Commit-Queue: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue:         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon based on this issue not having a POC, stack trace, or other artifacts to demonstrate this issue; additionally, this issue is mitigated by an extension, and actual exploitation potential appears to be theoretical to low due to the race with the UI thread. <span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon based on this issue not having a POC, stack trace, or other artifacts to demonstrate this issue; additionally, this issue is mitigated by an extension, and actual exploitation potential appears to be theoretical to low due to the race with the UI thread. <!----></span><br>If you can produce a POC or other demonstration of this issue, we would be happy to revisit for a reassessment for a potential change in reward amount. <span class="line"><!---->If you can produce a POC or other demonstration of this issue, we would be happy to revisit for a reassessment for a potential change in reward amount. <!----></span><br>Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Chrome version: 101.0.4951<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 101.0.4951<!----></span><br><br>[0] The `browser_context_` is posted to a separate sequence in function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback`<span class="line"><!---->[0] The `browser_context_` is posted to a separate sequence in function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback`<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144<!----></a><br>```<span public_key,<!----></span><br>    const base::FilePath& unpacked_dir,<span class="line"><!---->    const base::FilePath&amp; unpacked_dir,<!----></span><br>    bool install_immediately,<span {<!----></span><br>  VLOG(3) << "UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback " << extension_id << " "<span class="line"><!---->  VLOG(3) &lt;&lt; "UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback " &lt;&lt; extension_id &lt;&lt; " "<!----></span><br>          << public_key;<span class="line"><!---->          &lt;&lt; public_key;<!----></span><br><br>  if (!browser_context_) {<span class="line"><!----> base::MayBlock()},<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::BEST_EFFORT, base::MayBlock()},<!----></span><br>        base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir));<span content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>        FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br> update_client::CrxInstaller::Result(<span class="line"><!---->                       update_client::CrxInstaller::Result(<!----></span><br>                           update_client::InstallError::GENERIC_ERROR)));<span class="line"><!---->                           update_client::InstallError::GENERIC_ERROR)));<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->  content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(InstallUpdateCallback, browser_context_, extension_id,		// `browser_context_` can be freed before task is runned<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(InstallUpdateCallback, browser_context_, extension_id,		// `browser_context_` can be freed before task is runned<!----></span><br>                     public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->                     public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>                     std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] `browser_context_` may be destroyed in UI by the time the it runs, causing a UAF in InstallUpdateCallback callback.<span class="line"><!---->[1] `browser_context_` may be destroyed in UI by the time the it runs, causing a UAF in InstallUpdateCallback callback.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<span class="line"><!---->void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<!----></span><br>                           const std::string& extension_id,<span class="line"><!---->                           const std::string&amp; extension_id,<!----></span><br>                           const std::string& public_key,<span class="line"><!---->                           const std::string&amp; public_key,<!----></span><br>                           const base::FilePath& unpacked_dir,<span class="line"><!---->                           const base::FilePath&amp; unpacked_dir,<!----></span><br>                           bool install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->                           bool install_immediately,<!----></span><br>                           UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<span class="line"><!---->                           UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<!----></span><br>  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<span class="line"><!---->  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<!----></span><br>  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<span class="line"><!---->  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<!----></span><br>  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<span class="line"><!---->  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<!----></span><br>  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<span class="line"><!---->  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<!----></span><br>  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)->InstallUpdate(<span class="line"><!---->  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)-&gt;InstallUpdate(<!----></span><br>      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<span class="line"><!---->          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<!----></span><br>             const absl::optional<CrxInstallError>& error) {<span class="line"><!---->             const absl::optional&lt;CrxInstallError&gt;&amp; error) {<!----></span><br>            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<span class="line"><!---->            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<!----></span><br>            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<span class="line"><!---->            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<!----></span><br>            if (error.has_value()) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (error.has_value()) {<!----></span><br>              int detail =<span class="line"><!---->              int detail =<!----></span><br>                  error->type() ==<span class="line"><!---->                  error-&gt;type() ==<!----></span><br>                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<span class="line"><!---->                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<!----></span><br>                      ? static_cast<int>(error->sandbox_failure_detail())<span class="line"><!---->                      ? static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;sandbox_failure_detail())<!----></span><br>                      : static_cast<int>(error->detail());<span class="line"><!---->                      : static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;detail());<!----></span><br>              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error->type(), detail);<span class="line"><!---->              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error-&gt;type(), detail);<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            std::move(callback).Run(result);<span class="line"><!---->            std::move(callback).Run(result);<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->          std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<span class="line"><!---->[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<!----></span><br> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<span class="line"><!----> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<!----></span><br>  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<span class="line"><!---->  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<!----></span><br>   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<span class="line"><!---->   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<!----></span><br>    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<span class="line"><!---->    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<!----></span><br><br><br>[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <span class="line"><!---->[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <!----></span><br><br>I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
