base::MayBlock()},<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::BEST_EFFORT, base::MayBlock()},<!----></span><br>        base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir));<span class="line"><!---->        base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir));<!----></span><br>    content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->    content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>        FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>        base::BindOnce(std::move(update_client_callback),<span class="line"><!---->        base::BindOnce(std::move(update_client_callback),<!----></span><br>                       update_client::CrxInstaller::Result(<span class="line"><!---->                       update_client::CrxInstaller::Result(<!----></span><br>                           update_client::InstallError::GENERIC_ERROR)));<span class="line"><!---->                           update_client::InstallError::GENERIC_ERROR)));<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->  content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(InstallUpdateCallback, browser_context_, extension_id,		// `browser_context_` can be freed before task is runned<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(InstallUpdateCallback, browser_context_, extension_id,		// `browser_context_` can be freed before task is runned<!----></span><br>                     public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->                     public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>                     std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] `browser_context_` may be destroyed in UI by the time the it runs, causing a UAF in InstallUpdateCallback callback.<span class="line"><!---->[1] `browser_context_` may be destroyed in UI by the time the it runs, causing a UAF in InstallUpdateCallback callback.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<span class="line"><!---->void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<!----></span><br>                           const std::string& extension_id,<span class="line"><!---->                           const std::string&amp; extension_id,<!----></span><br>                           const std::string& public_key,<span class="line"><!---->                           const std::string&amp; public_key,<!----></span><br>                           const base::FilePath& unpacked_dir,<span class="line"><!---->                           const base::FilePath&amp; unpacked_dir,<!----></span><br>                           bool install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->                           bool install_immediately,<!----></span><br>                           UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<span class="line"><!---->                           UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<!----></span><br>  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<span class="line"><!---->  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<!----></span><br>  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<span class="line"><!---->  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<!----></span><br>  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<span class="line"><!---->  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<!----></span><br>  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<span class="line"><!---->  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<!----></span><br>  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)->InstallUpdate(<span class="line"><!---->  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)-&gt;InstallUpdate(<!----></span><br>      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<span class="line"><!---->          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<!----></span><br>             const absl::optional<CrxInstallError>& error) {<span class="line"><!---->             const absl::optional&lt;CrxInstallError&gt;&amp; error) {<!----></span><br>            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<span class="line"><!---->            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<!----></span><br>            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<span class="line"><!---->            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<!----></span><br>            if (error.has_value()) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (error.has_value()) {<!----></span><br>              int detail =<span class="line"><!---->              int detail =<!----></span><br>                  error->type() ==<span class="line"><!---->                  error-&gt;type() ==<!----></span><br>                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<span class="line"><!---->                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<!----></span><br>                      ? static_cast<int>(error->sandbox_failure_detail())<span class="line"><!---->                      ? static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;sandbox_failure_detail())<!----></span><br>                      : static_cast<int>(error->detail());<span class="line"><!---->                      : static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;detail());<!----></span><br>              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error->type(), detail);<span class="line"><!---->              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error-&gt;type(), detail);<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            std::move(callback).Run(result);<span class="line"><!---->            std::move(callback).Run(result);<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->          std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<span class="line"><!---->[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<!----></span><br> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<span class="line"><!----> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<!----></span><br>  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<span class="line"><!---->  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<!----></span><br>   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<span class="line"><!---->   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<!----></span><br>    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<span class="line"><!---->    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<!----></span><br><br><br>[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <span class="line"><!---->[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <!----></span><br><br>I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I didn't pay much attention for lack of PoC, here's my thought:<span class="line"><!---->I didn't pay much attention for lack of PoC, here's my thought:<!----></span><br><br>We can add "is valid browser context" check and bail out if it isn't, like we do here: <span class="line"><!---->We can add "is valid browser context" check and bail out if it isn't, like we do here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/runtime/runtime_api.cc;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;l=116<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/runtime/runtime_api.cc;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;l=116"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/runtime/runtime_api.cc;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;l=116<!----></a><br><br>TL/DR;<span class="line"><!---->TL/DR;<!----></span><br>void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<span class="line"><!---->void InstallUpdateCallback(content::BrowserContext* context,<!----></span><br>   ...) {<span class="line"><!---->   ...) {<!----></span><br>  if (!ExtensionsBrowserClient::Get()->IsValidContext(browser_context))<span class="line"><!---->  if (!ExtensionsBrowserClient::Get()-&gt;IsValidContext(browser_context))<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323449<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323449" title="Security: Use-after-Free in InstallUpdateCallback"><!---->Bug: 1323449<!----></a><br>Change-Id: If617676d2e0e6a31a7936d88c75dd221c69b1057<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon based on this issue not having a POC, stack trace, or other artifacts to demonstrate this issue; additionally, this issue is mitigated by an extension, and actual exploitation potential appears to be theoretical to low due to the race with the UI thread. <span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon based on this issue not having a POC, stack trace, or other artifacts to demonstrate this issue; additionally, this issue is mitigated by an extension, and actual exploitation potential appears to be theoretical to low due to the race with the UI thread. <!----></span><br>If you can produce a POC or other demonstration of this issue, we would be happy to revisit for a reassessment for a potential change in reward amount. <span class="line"><!---->If you can produce a POC or other demonstration of this issue, we would be happy to revisit for a reassessment for a potential change in reward amount. <!----></span><br>Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         1. Just <span class="line"><!---->1. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function.       Chrome version: 101.0.4951<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 101.0.4951<!----></span><br><br>[0] The `browser_context_` is posted to a separate sequence in function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback`<span class="line"><!---->[0] The `browser_context_` is posted to a separate sequence in function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback`<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=06b7fdb48dea3de43ab2b3fc996bdc3e09abbd9a;l=144<!----></a><br>```<span public_key,<!----></span><br>    const base::FilePath& unpacked_dir,<span class="line"><!---->    const base::FilePath&amp; unpacked_dir,<!----></span><br>    bool install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->    bool install_immediately,<!----></span><br>    UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<span class="line"><!---->    UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) extension_id &lt;&lt; " "<!----></span><br>          << public_key;<span class="line"><!---->          &lt;&lt; public_key;<!----></span><br><br>  if (!browser_context_) {<span class="line"><!----> base::MayBlock()},<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::BEST_EFFORT, base::MayBlock()},<!----></span><br>        base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir));<span content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>        FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  content::GetUIThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->                   const std::string& public_key,<span class="line"><!---->                           const std::string&amp; public_key,<!----></span><br>                           const                UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<!----></span><br>  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<span class="line"><!---->  // Note that This means that custom codes<span class="line"><!---->  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<!----></span><br>  // from different embedders may collide. static_cast<int>(error->sandbox_failure_detail())<span class="line"><!---->                      ? static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;sandbox_failure_detail())<!----></span><br>                      : static_cast<int>(error->detail());<span class="line"><!---->                      : static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;detail());<!----></span><br>              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error->type(), detail);<span class="line"><!---->              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error-&gt;type(), detail);<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            std::move(callback).Run(result);<span class="line"><!---->            std::move(callback).Run(result);<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->          std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<span class="line"><!---->[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<!----></span><br> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<span class="line"><!----> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<!----></span><br>  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<span class="line"><!---->  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<!----></span><br>   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<span class="line"><!---->   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<!----></span><br>    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<span class="line"><!---->    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<!----></span><br><br><br>[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <span class="line"><!---->[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <!----></span><br><br>I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have a poc, just code inspection.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323449<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323449" title="Security: Use-after-Free in InstallUpdateCallback"><!---->Bug: 1323449<!----></a><br>Change-Id: If617676d2e0e6a31a7936d88c75dd221c69b1057<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon based on this issue not having a POC, stack trace, or other artifacts to demonstrate this issue; additionally, this issue is mitigated by an extension, and actual exploitation potential appears to be theoretical to low due to the race with the UI thread. <span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2. href="https://crrev.com/64e1b8564bd967d652531df287b58277f550d206"><!---->64e1b8564bd967d652531df287b58277f550d206<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Aug 12 14:11:03 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Aug 12 14:11:03 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M96-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[M96-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>M96 merge issues:<span class="line"><!---->M96 merge issues:<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.h:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.h:<!----></span><br>    conflicting types for browser_context_<span class="line"><!---->    conflicting types for browser_context_<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<!----></span><br>    Conflict in calls in deleted code:<span class="line"><!---->    Conflict in calls in deleted code:<!----></span><br>      main uses base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir) as<span class="line"><!---->      main uses base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir) as<!----></span><br>      3rd argument of PostTask, M96 uses:<span class="line"><!---->      3rd argument of PostTask, M96 uses:<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf"><!---->6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Aug 18 10:11:30 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Aug 18 10:11:30 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M102-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[M102-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>M102 merge issues:<span class="line"><!---->M102 merge issues:<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<!----></span><br>    Conflicts in deleted code in RunInstallCallback after the browser_context_ check, kept the version from the CL.<span class="line"><!---->    Conflicts in deleted code in RunInstallCallback after the browser_context_ check, kept the version from the CL.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit callback.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc;drc=3810f9d8c604ed06d6c14df979e940eabcc8c897;l=38<a                UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<!----></span><br>  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<span class="line"><!---->  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<!----></span><br>  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<span class="line"><!---->  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<!----></span><br>  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<span class="line"><!---->  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<!----></span><br>  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<span class="line"><!---->  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<!----></span><br>  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)->InstallUpdate(<span class="line"><!---->  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)-&gt;InstallUpdate(<!----></span><br>      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<span class="line"><!---->          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<!----></span><br>             const absl::optional<CrxInstallError>& error) {<span class="line"><!---->             const absl::optional&lt;CrxInstallError&gt;&amp; error) {<!----></span><br>            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<span class="line"><!---->            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<!----></span><br>            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<span class="line"><!---->            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<!----></span><br>            if (error.has_value()) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (error.has_value()) {<!----></span><br>              int detail =<span class="line"><!---->              int detail =<!----></span><br>                  error->type() ==<span class="line"><!---->                  error-&gt;type() ==<!----></span><br>                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<span class="line"><!---->                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<!----></span><br>                      ? static_cast<int>(error->sandbox_failure_detail())<span class="line"><!---->                      ? static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;sandbox_failure_detail())<!----></span><br>                      : static_cast<int>(error->detail());<span class="line"><!---->                      : static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;detail());<!----></span><br>              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error->type(), detail);<span class="line"><!---->              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error-&gt;type(), detail);<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            std::move(callback).Run(result);<span class="line"><!---->            std::move(callback).Run(result);<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->          std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<span class="line"><!---->[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<!----></span><br> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<span class="line"><!----> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<!----></span><br>  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<span class="line"><!---->  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<!----></span><br>   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<span class="line"><!---->   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<!----></span><br>    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<span class="line"><!---->    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<!----></span><br><br><br>[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <span class="line"><!---->[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <!----></span><br><br>I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323449<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323449" title="Security: Use-after-Free in InstallUpdateCallback"><!---->Bug: 1323449<!----></a><br>Change-Id: If617676d2e0e6a31a7936d88c75dd221c69b1057<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: If617676d2e0e6a31a7936d88c75dd221c69b1057<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin &lt;<!----></span>rdevlin.cronin@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2. href="https://crrev.com/64e1b8564bd967d652531df287b58277f550d206"><!---->64e1b8564bd967d652531df287b58277f550d206<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Aug 12 14:11:03 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Aug 12 14:11:03 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M96-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[M96-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>M96 merge issues:<span class="line"><!---->M96 merge issues:<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.h:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.h:<!----></span><br>    conflicting types for browser_context_<span class="line"><!---->    conflicting types for browser_context_<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<!----></span><br>    Conflict in calls in deleted code:<span class="line"><!---->    Conflict in calls in deleted code:<!----></span><br>      main uses base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir) as<span class="line"><!---->      main uses base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir) as<!----></span><br>      3rd argument of PostTask, M96 uses:<span class="line"><!---->      3rd argument of PostTask, M96 uses:<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf"><!---->6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Aug 18 10:11:30 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Aug 18 10:11:30 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M102-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[M102-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>M102 merge issues:<span class="line"><!---->M102 merge issues:<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<!----></span><br>    Conflicts in deleted code in RunInstallCallback after the browser_context_ check, kept the version from the CL.<span class="line"><!---->    Conflicts in deleted code in RunInstallCallback after the browser_context_ check, kept the version from the CL.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit                UpdateClientCallback update_client_callback) {<!----></span><br>  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<span class="line"><!---->  // Note that error codes are converted into custom error codes, which are all<!----></span><br>  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<span class="line"><!---->  // based on a constant (see ToInstallerResult). This means that custom codes<!----></span><br>  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<span class="line"><!---->  // from different embedders may collide. However, for any given extension ID,<!----></span><br>  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<span class="line"><!---->  // there should be only one embedder, so this should be OK from Omaha.<!----></span><br>  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)->InstallUpdate(<span class="line"><!---->  ExtensionSystem::Get(context)-&gt;InstallUpdate(<!----></span><br>      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<span class="line"><!---->      extension_id, public_key, unpacked_dir, install_immediately,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<span class="line"><!---->          [](UpdateClientCallback callback,<!----></span><br>             const absl::optional<CrxInstallError>& error) {<span class="line"><!---->             const absl::optional&lt;CrxInstallError&gt;&amp; error) {<!----></span><br>            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<span class="line"><!---->            DCHECK_CURRENTLY_ON(content::BrowserThread::UI);<!----></span><br>            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<span class="line"><!---->            update_client::CrxInstaller::Result result(0);<!----></span><br>            if (error.has_value()) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (error.has_value()) {<!----></span><br>              int detail =<span class="line"><!---->              int detail =<!----></span><br>                  error->type() ==<span class="line"><!---->                  error-&gt;type() ==<!----></span><br>                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<span class="line"><!---->                          CrxInstallErrorType::SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE<!----></span><br>                      ? static_cast<int>(error->sandbox_failure_detail())<span class="line"><!---->                      ? static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;sandbox_failure_detail())<!----></span><br>                      : static_cast<int>(error->detail());<span class="line"><!---->                      : static_cast&lt;int&gt;(error-&gt;detail());<!----></span><br>              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error->type(), detail);<span class="line"><!---->              result = update_client::ToInstallerResult(error-&gt;type(), detail);<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            std::move(callback).Run(result);<span class="line"><!---->            std::move(callback).Run(result);<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          std::move(update_client_callback)));<span class="line"><!---->          std::move(update_client_callback)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<span class="line"><!---->[2] To trigger this vulnerability, we can use developerPrivate.autoUpdate function, which can be used from the chrome extension. The path leads to buggy function `UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback` is<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider::RunInstallCallback<!----></span><br> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<span class="line"><!----> UpdateDataProvider::GetData<!----></span><br>  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<span class="line"><!---->  UpdateService::StartUpdateCheck<!----></span><br>   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<span class="line"><!---->   ExtensionUpdater::CheckNow<!----></span><br>    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<span class="line"><!---->    DeveloperPrivateAutoUpdateFunction::Run<!----></span><br><br><br>[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <span class="line"><!---->[3] In addition, due to conditional competition with the UI thread. The browser_context_ used by InstallUpdateCallback is destructed first in UI, so it's maybe hard to trigger the crash. I am working on trying to build a poc. <!----></span><br><br>I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have a poc, just code inspection. I'll upload poc as soon as i can trigger crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I have a fix for this:<span class="line"><!---->I have a fix for this:<!----></span><br><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<!----></a><br><br>However, it's stuck behind figuring out how to write unit tests to verify it. That's somewhat complicated because of multiple layers of tasks that are posted. I suppose I could commit the fix now and add tests later, but isn't ideal.<!----></span><br><br>The fix proposed in <span class="line"><!---->The fix proposed in <!----></span>#c10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c10"><!---->#c10<!----></a> is incomplete, because other pointers can become invalidated when the BrowserContext is deleted.<span class="line"><!----> is incomplete, because other pointers can become invalidated when the BrowserContext is deleted.<!----></span><br><br>I suspect this will be very difficult to trigger in the real world, but it would be great to have a test case that can reproduce it deterministically.<span class="line"><!---->I suspect this will be very difficult to trigger in the real world, but it would be great to have a test case that can reproduce it deterministically.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 30 17:32:48 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323449<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323449" title="Security: Use-after-Free in InstallUpdateCallback"><!---->Bug: 1323449<!----></a><br>Change-Id: If617676d2e0e6a31a7936d88c75dd221c69b1057<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: If617676d2e0e6a31a7936d88c75dd221c69b1057<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3688185<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin &lt;<!----></span>rdevlin.cronin@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/rdevlin.cronin@chromium.org"><!---->rdevlin.cronin@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Commit-Queue: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1019720}<span class="line"><!---->Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1019720}<!----></span><br><br>[modify] <span class="line"><!---->[modify] <!----></span>https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7/extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7/extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc"><!---->https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7/extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc<!----></a><br>[modify] <span class="line"><!---->[modify] <!----></span>https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7/extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.h<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon based on this issue not having a POC, stack trace, or other artifacts to demonstrate this issue; additionally, this issue is mitigated by an extension, and actual exploitation potential appears to be theoretical to low due to the race with the UI thread. <span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! issues:<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.h:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.h:<!----></span><br>    conflicting types for extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<!----></span><br>    Conflict in calls in deleted code:<span class="line"><!---->    Conflict in calls in deleted code:<!----></span><br>      main uses base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir) as<span class="line"><!---->      main uses base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(unpacked_dir) as<!----></span><br>      3rd argument of class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(base::GetDeletePathRecursivelyCallback(), unpacked_dir)<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf"><!---->6c1ee1e6d7ef6146cd536a850b4e1f47d72b52bf<!----></a><br>Author: David Bertoni <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bertoni &lt;<!----></span>dbertoni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dbertoni@chromium.org"><!---->dbertoni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Aug 18 10:11:30 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Aug 18 10:11:30 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M102-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<span class="line"><!---->[M102-LTS][Extensions] Fix potential UAF in UpdateDataProvider.<!----></span><br><br>M102 merge issues:<span class="line"><!---->M102 merge issues:<!----></span><br>  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<span class="line"><!---->  extensions/browser/updater/update_data_provider.cc:<!----></span><br>    Conflicts in deleted code in RunInstallCallback after the browser_context_ check, kept the version from the CL.<span class="line"><!---->    Conflicts in deleted code in RunInstallCallback after the browser_context_ check, kept the version from the CL.<!----></span><br><br>UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<span class="line"><!---->UpdateDataProvider post a task that can be run after its BrowserContext is destroyed, leading to user-after-free. This CL instead binds the UpdateDataProvider instance to the callback and uses a member function instead of a static function. This ensures the the UpdateDataProvider instance will be alive when the callback is executed.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7"><!---->2dbb348fdb87962bcb7ad11e59449d4a32d32be7<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323449<a            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
